intro: Roubieva bonariensis, commonly known as the Argentine hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance. Roubieva bonariensis prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
